titles.title: Corning National Fish Hatchery Conveyance Act of 1994
Corning National Fish Hatchery Conveyance Act of 1994
To require the Secretary of the Interior to convey the Corning National Fish Hatchery to the State of Arkansas.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Management.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 103-586.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 323.

action.text: Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.name: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Text of bill contained in committee amendment to H.R. 3664.

bill.summary: 7/12/1994--Passed House amended. Corning National Fish Hatchery Conveyance Act of 1994 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to convey to the State of Arkansas, without reimbursement, the Corning National Fish Hatchery (popularly known as the William H. Donham State Fish Hatchery) near Corning, Arkansas.
